description: Interact with databases using JPA Repositories and simplified queries.

slides.title: What is Spring Data JPA?
slides.content:
# Magic Queries ‚ú®

Abstractions over JPA (Hibernate).

It drastically reduces the amount of boilerplate code required to implement data access layers.

No more `EntityManager` code.

slides.title: Entities
Repositories
slides.content:
# The Interface üîå

Create an interface extending `JpaRepository`.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
public interface UserRepository extends JpaRepository<User, Long> {
}
FULL_CODE_END -->

Spring automatically provides an implementation at runtime.

slides.title: CRUD Operations
slides.content:
# Built-in Methods üõ†Ô∏è

Just by extending, you get:

- `.save(user)`
- `.findById(id)`
- `.findAll()`
- `.deleteById(id)`
- `.count()`

slides.title: Derived Queries
slides.content:
# Method Naming üìõ

Spring parses method names to create queries.

`List<User> findByName(String name);`

`User findByEmailAndActiveTrue(String email);`

`List<User> findByAgeGreaterThan(int age);`

# Lightweight Views üçÉ

Fetch only needed columns.

Define an Interface with getters.

`interface UserNameOnly { String getName(); }`

`List<UserNameOnly> findByNameStartingWith(String prefix);`

slides.title: Auditing
slides.content:
# Auto Timestamps üïí

- `@EnableJpaAuditing` configuration.
- `@CreatedDate`: Auto set on insert.
- `@LastModifiedDate`: Auto set on update.

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Spring Data üíæ

Zero boilerplate.

- **Entities:** Annotate with `@Entity`.
- **Repository:** Extend `JpaRepository`.
- **Queries:** `findByName(name)`.
- **Custom:** `@Query` annotation.
